subject: assertTrue missing from junit.framework
msgSnippet: Hi, Newbie question here.  I currently downloaded and installed Junit on my Windows XP machine.  I m running JDK 1.4.2.  I m trying to run the SimpleTest
messageBody:
Hi,

Newbie question here. I currently downloaded and installed Junit on
my Windows XP machine. I'm running JDK 1.4.2. I'm trying to run
the SimpleTest provided by www.junit.org's documentation. But my
class doesn't compile.


package junitfaq;

import java.util.*;
import junit.framework.*;

public class SimpleTest extends TestCase {
public SimpleTest(String name) {
super(name);
}


public void testEmptyCollection() {
Collection collection = new ArrayList();
junit.framework.Assert.assertTrue(collection.isEmpty());
}

public static Test suite() {
return new TestSuite(SimpleTest.class);
}

public static void main(String args[]) {
junit.textui.TestRunner.run(suite());
}
}

I get the following error...
C:\workspaces\java\junit\MyTestCase\java\util\SimpleTest.java:14:
cannot resolve symbol
symbol : method assertTrue (boolean)
location: class junit.framework.Assert
junit.framework.Assert.assertTrue(collection.isEmpty());
^
1 error

Why does the documentation refer to a method 'assertTrue' this isn't
apart of the framework? Why am I getting this error? Can anyone
shed a little light on the problem?

Thanks,
Justin
